intro: Deyeuxia korotkyi, commonly known as the Korotkyi sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including countries such as Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. This perennial herb typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and along riverbanks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
